intro: Pellionia undulata, commonly known as velvetleaf, is a herbaceous plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is characterized by its soft, velvety foliage that gives it its common name. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30 cm, with heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Pellionia undulata thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are followed by oval-shaped berries.
